p: Currently, there is no standard of care for adjuvant/neoadjuvant treatment and although a number of approaches have been attempted including trans-arterial chemoembolization (TACE), Yttrium-90 radioembolization, and neoadjuvant sorafenib in HCC patients on waiting list for liver transplantation [ 13â€“ 15]. Failure to control micro-metastatic disease is a major determinant influencing early relapse and mortality following curative resection and randomized controlled trials have shown sorafenib, to be ineffective in improving outcomes in the adjuvant setting [ 16].
